Dear Melynda Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000390
Special Investigation Intake Date: February 20, 2025
License #: CI250201521
Licensee Group Organization: Whaley Children's Center
Licensee Designee: Melynda Williams
Chief Administrator: Melynda Williams
Agency Name: ZONTA HOUSE
Agency Address: 2954 CONCORD ST
FLINT, MI 48504-3040
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/20/2026
Capacity: 6
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
3/28/2025 Phone Interview
3/12/2025 Face to Face Interview
2/25/2025 Face to Face Interview
2/25/2025 Onsite Inspection Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section CCI Rule 400.4158
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory
or discriminatory language including negative references to a
1

youth's background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth does not feel safe at the facility because staff are mean. An
unknown staff member looked at youth and told her to keep on
moving little girl. Another staff member told youth, “I'm bout that
life, I will do you really quick.” Unknown what this statement meant
but youth took it as a threat.
Investigation Interviews
The following interviews were completed at Whaley Center on
2/25/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview with Youth A was completed. She reported staff at
the agency cuss a lot at the youth. When asked for specifics she
clarified that she was speaking of Staff 1 and Staff 3. She
reported that she has heard them both use the “N” word when
addressing youth at the facility and has heard them both curse at
other youth. Youth A reported about two weeks ago, Staff 1 told
her “you better get your ass on somewhere”. She denied that
Staff 1 or Staff 3 have been physically abusive. Youth A also
reported hearing Staff 1 tell Youth B that she would never find a
foster home and if she did, they would give up on her. Youth A
also heard Staff 3 say to Youth C “I can really do you”. Youth A
denied knowing what Staff 3 meant when saying this. Youth A
also reported that Staff 1 said to her “keep it pushing little girl”.
Youth A denied knowing what was meant by the statement, but
stated she interpreted it as a threat.
An interview with Youth B was completed. She reported feeling
safe at the agency and denied receiving any inappropriate
physical discipline. She reported getting along with staff at Zonta.
She reported Staff 1 has an attitude with the kids all the time and
gets mad for no reason. Youth B reported she has heard Staff 1
say “under her breath” that the youth get on her nerves. Youth B
denied that Staff 1 or any other staff have called her names.
Youth B also reported that Staff 1 told her if she “keeps doing
what she is doing” the family that is interested in her will change
their mind and won’t want to adopt her. Youth B denied having
any concerns with Staff 3 and described her as “cool”. She stated
that everyone at Zonta loves Staff 3 and denied that any other
staff has said mean things to her.
2

An interview with Youth C was completed. She reported feeling
safe at the agency. She reported that Staff 1 and Staff 3 are not
nice, she did not elaborate about what she meant about the staff
not being nice. She reported a staff member at Zonta told her she
“moves so fucking slow” a couple of months ago, but she was
unable to identify the staff. She further stated she wished staff
would be more understanding. Youth C also reported she heard
Staff 1 tell Youth B that her adoptive family is going to give her
back.
An interview with Staff 1 was completed. She denied cursing at
or speaking in a negative manner with the youth. She specifically
denied making statements to the youth such as “I’m about that
life” or “I’ll do you real quick”. Staff 1 reported she does not recall
making the specific statement of “keep moving little girl” to Youth
A or any other youth in the program. She stated if she made a
similar statement, it was not in a harmful or threatening way. She
reported that the youth in the program are not always pleased with
the consistency and structure she provides during her shift. Staff
1 denied hearing other staff speak to the youth at Zonta in a
negative, derogatory or threatening manner. She confirmed that
she spoke with Youth A about how her behavior could impact her
placement opportunities, but denied that it was stated in a
derogatory or negative way.
An interview with Staff 2 was completed. She denied hearing any
staff use profanity or make threats to youth at the agency.
An interview with the Compliance Supervisor was completed.
She denied knowledge of any staff using profanity or making
threats toward the youth in the program. She acknowledged that
Youth A and Youth B had recently expressed the concerns. She
denied there are any incident reports documenting the use of
profanity or derogatory language with youth in the program.
Compliance Supervisor did report she has heard some youth at
Zonta house complain that Staff 1 is too strict. She stated that
Staff 1 holds the youth accountable and follows agency policy and
that is why the youth think she is too strict.
On 02/25/2025 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional information.
On 03/05/2025 an interview of Youth F was completed at Whaley
Center. Youth F reported that Staff 5 would call the youth
“hussies and hoes”. She reported Staff 5 also used profanity and
would tell them she could cuss because she is a grown hoe, but
3

that she did not want them to become like her. She also reported
that when they were all in the agency van coming from main
campus, Staff 5 told her to “shut the fuck up”, told Youth E to
worry about her hygiene and told Youth C she was weird. Youth F
further confirmed that Youth C got angry at Staff 5 and jumped out
of the van while if was moving. Youth F stated that Staff 5 kept
driving and it seemed like she even sped the van up. She lastly
stated that Youth C was not injured and agency staff returned her
to Zonta.
On 03/05/2025 an interview was completed with Youth E at
Whaley Center. She reported that she was in the agency van with
Staff 5, Youth C and Youth F when Staff 5 was calling them
“hussies and hoes”. She recalled that everyone in the car was
yelling and screaming. She reported that Staff 5 was telling youth
they needed to worry about their hygiene, called Youth C weird
and told another youth to shut the fuck up.
On 03/05/2025 an interview was held with Manager 1. She
denied any concerns with Staff 1 using profanity toward the youth.
She described Staff 1 as strict with the youth and holds them
accountable with their behavior, chores, etc.
The following interviews were completed at Whaley Center on
3/12/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview with Youth C was completed. She reported that Staff
5 is not nice and does not like her. She stated recently when Staff
5 was transporting youth in the agency van, Staff 5 was using
profanity at the youth and told Youth F to “Shut the Fuck Up”, told
Youth E to worry about her hygiene and told Youth C she is a
“weird” kid. Youth C reported she chose to get out of the agency
van so she could calm down and not hit Staff 5. Youth C stated
she feels like Staff 1 lacks understanding. She denied that Staff 1
or Staff 3 used profanity toward her or called her names. Youth C
did report hearing Staff 1 tell Youth B that her adoptive family is
going to give her up if she keeps doing what she is doing.
An interview with Youth D was completed. She denied
knowledge of Staff 1 or Staff 3 using profanity or speaking in a
derogatory manner to youth.
The following interviews were completed via telephone on
03/28/2025 unless otherwise noted.
4

An interview with Staff 3 was completed. She advised that she is
no longer employed with the agency. She denied using profanity
toward the youth or speaking to them in a derogatory or
threatening manner. Staff 3 did acknowledge making the
statement “let me clock out before I slap this girl,” but denied that
she had any intention to slap the youth. Staff 3 denied hearing
other staff use profanity or threaten youth. Staff 3 reported that
the youth did not like the structure and consistency that she
attempted to enforce on her shift.
An interview with Staff 4 was completed. Staff 4 reported she
heard Staff 5 speak negatively to the youth and use profanity.
She also reported hearing Staff 3 make the statement that she
needs to “clock out before she slaps this girl. Lastly, Staff 4
denied hearing or having knowledge of Staff 1 using profanity or
threatening the youth.
An interview with Staff 5 was completed. She advised that she is
no longer employed with the agency as of two weeks ago. She
reported she was transporting Youth C, Youth F and Youth E from
main campus in the agency van. She stated the youth were being
disorderly and when she attempted to redirect them, they became
escalated. She advised that she told Youth C to “chill”. Staff 5
reported that Youth C was upset because she was redirecting the
behavior of the youth. Youth C told Staff 5 to “shut the fuck up”,
growled at her and balled her fist up toward Staff 5. Staff 5 denied
ever hearing Staff 1 or Staff 3 use profanity toward the youth or
speak to them in a threatening or derogatory manner. Lastly, Staff
5 denied making statements to the youth in the van regarding their
hygiene or calling any youth weird.
An interview with Staff 6 was completed. She confirmed that she
has heard Staff 5 use profanity toward the youth. She denied
hearing or having knowledge of Staff 1 or Staff 3 using profanity or
speaking to the youth in a derogatory or threatening manner.
A telephone call was attempted to Manager 1. A voicemail
message was left requesting a return call.
Documents Reviewed
Whaley Physical Intervention Policy – indicates any type of
physical punishment including but not limited to: iv. Verbal abuse
including the use of derogatory or discriminatory language
including negative references to a youth’s background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
5

Whaley Investigative Report – Dated 3/4/2025. Report indicates
that Compliance Supervisor responded to youth complaint
regarding staff. During interviews by Compliance Supervisor
Youth C reported that Staff 5 used profanity toward her and two
other youth when transporting them in the agency van. She
reported that Staff 5 told her she is a “weird kid”, told Youth D to
“shut the fuck up”, and told Youth E she needs to worry about her
hygiene.
The report went on to state that Youth E was interviewed by
Compliance Supervisor and reported Staff 5 would call the youth
“hussies”, curse at them often and reference them washing their
vaginas.
The report also stated Youth C was interviewed by Compliance
Supervisor and reported Staff 5 called her peers out of their
names and called them “hussies”. Youth C advised that Staff 6
had overheard Staff 5 curse at them.
Whaley Children’s Center (WCC) Residential Department Policies
and Procedures – Child Supervision and Treatment. Policy
indicates Due to the trauma history of the youth placed at WCC
and the nature of some of the behaviors exhibited by the children
in our care, it is crucial that all staff maintain professional
boundaries and refrain from inappropriate and unprofessional
interactions with the children placed at the Center.
Agency Tour
On 03/12/2025 a tour of Zonta House was completed. Agency
found to be well maintained, and no areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4158-1-a-iv. Interviews
were completed with both Staff and Youth at it was confirmed that
Staff 3 and Staff 5 engaged in the use of derogatory and negative
language with youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
Section staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
6

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff speed up the van when youth jumped from the vehicle.
Investigation Interviews
The following interviews were completed at Whaley Center on
2/25/2025 unless otherwise noted.
On 03/05/2025 an interview of Youth F was completed at Whaley
Center. Youth F also reported that when they were all in the
agency van coming from main campus, Youth C got angry at Staff
5 and jumped out of the van while it was moving. Youth F stated
that Staff 5 kept driving and it seemed like she even sped the van
up. She lastly stated that Youth C was not injured and agency
staff returned her to Zonta.
On 03/05/2025 an interview was completed with Youth E at
Whaley Center. She reported that she was in the agency van with
Staff 5, Youth C and Youth F. She recalled that everyone in the
car was yelling and screaming. She stated she heard Youth C
say that she has jumped out of a moving car before and she will
do it again. Youth E said before she knew it, Youth C had jumped
from the van. Youth E reported that Staff 5 sped up when she
heard Youth C say she was going to jump out of the van. Youth E
stated that Youth C was not really injured as she returned to Zonta
that night and refused to go to the hospital.
The following interviews were completed at Whaley Center on
3/12/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview with Youth C was completed. She reported that she
chose to get out of the agency van so she could calm down and
not hit Staff 5 because of how she was engaging with all of the
youth in the van. Youth C reported she said out loud, “I jumped
out of a moving car before and I’ll do it again”. She stated the
youth were trying to redirect her, but Staff 5 did not say anything.
Youth C stated when she jumped out the car she felt like Staff 5
sped the car up. Youth C was unsure how fast the van was going,
but estimates that it was about 15 to 20 miles per hour. She was
unable to advise how she came up with the mph estimate. She
reported after jumping out of the vehicle, she landed on the
ground but denied that she hit the curb. Youth C denied that she
was injured and stated she started walking back to main campus
and was picked up by staff. She reported she was seen by a
nurse and transported back to Zonta.
7

The following interviews were completed via telephone on
03/28/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview with Staff 4 was completed. She denied she was on
shift the day Youth C jumped from the agency vehicle and denied
knowledge about anything that occurred on that day.
An interview with Staff 5 was completed. She advised that she is
no longer employed with the agency as of two weeks ago. She
reported she was transporting Youth C, Youth F and Youth E from
main campus in the agency van. She stated the youth were being
disorderly and when she attempted to redirect them, they became
escalated. She advised that she told Youth C to “chill”. Staff 5
reported she heard Youth C say “I did it before and I will do it
again”. Staff 5 reported that Youth C then opened the door and
jumped out of the van. Staff 5 did not recall the approximate rate
of speed she was driving, but confirmed the vehicle was moving.
Staff 5 reported she turned the vehicle around to look for Youth C
and also called Manager 1. Staff 5 advised that she was told to
take the other girls back to the house. Staff 5 denied that she
sped the vehicle up when Youth C went to jump out. Staff 5
denied that Youth C appeared injured after jumping from the van.
A telephone call was attempted to Manager 1. A voicemail
message was left requesting a return call.
An email correspondence was received from the Compliance
Supervisor. She advised by email that the agency was unable to
retrieve camera footage from the agency vehicle.
Documents Reviewed
Whaley Investigative Report – Dated 03/04/2025. Indicated that
Youth F was interviewed by Compliance Supervisor and advised
that once Staff 5 and youth got in the agency vehicle to head back
to Zonta house, Staff 5 continued to antagonize them and engage
in the power struggle with the youth. Youth F explained that Youth
C was upset and this is when she threatened to jump out of the
agency vehicle. She went on to express that Staff 5 seemed to not
care and just sped the vehicle up. She lastly reported that Youth C
then jumped out of the vehicle and Staff 5 continued to drive.
The investigative report also indicated that Youth E was
interviewed, During the interview Youth E reported that Youth C
was arguing with Staff 5 and then jumped out of the vehicle. Youth
E reported Staff 5 sped up as Youth C was jumping out of the
8

vehicle. She further reported that Staff 5 did not Youth C and just
continued to drive.
The investigative report lasted indicated that Youth C was
interviewed. Youth C reported that Staff 5 antagonized her and
the other youth in the vehicle, which is what led to her (Youth C)
jumping out of the vehicle and going AWOL. She stated that Staff
5 did not stop the vehicle when she jumped out and continued
driving after she jumped out.
Zonta Nursing Note for Youth C – Entry dated 2/23/2025 at 8:58
pm documents that Youth C was seen after she jumped out of a
moving vehicle. Her head examined and no concerns noted.
Youth given Tylenol for pain. Youth refused to go to the hospital.
Whaley Mott Incident Report dated 2/23/25 submitted by Staff 7.
IR indicated that Youth C was seen AWOL walking down Grand
Traverse by Whaley and was told by Staff 7 to get into the vehicle.
Youth C cooperated and got into the vehicle. Staff 7 documented
that she was taken back to Motts and was seen by the nurse to
get checked out. No injuries were noted and after nurse contact,
youth was returned to Zonta.
Whaley Mott Incident Report dated 2/23/25 submitted by Staff 5.
IR indicated that that she was driving the agency vehicle and the
youth riding in the vehicle were escalated and she was attempting
to talk to them about their behavior. Youth C made threats toward
Staff 5 and then threatened to jump out of the vehicle. Staff 5
reported that Youth C stated “I’m finna jump out. I did it before
and I’ll do it again”. Staff 5 reported that Youth C jumped out of
the car, landed on some ice, got up and started walking up the
road. Staff 5 reported that she turned around, followed Youth C
and call the supervisor. Staff 5 indicated that she was advised to
return the other youth back to Zonta.
Agency Tour
On 03/12/2025 a tour of Zonta House was completed. Agency
found to be well maintained, and no areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with licensing rule 4112-4-a. Interviews were
completed with both Staff and Youth at there was not sufficient
evidence to support allegations that the staff placed the youth at
harm by speeding up when the youth made the decision to jump
from the vehicle. Although the agency vehicles are equipped with
video, there was not video footage available for review.
9

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
